verses.devanagari:
केनेषितं पतति प्रेषितं मनः ।
केन प्राणः प्रथमः प्रैति युक्तः ।
केनेषितां वाचमिमां वदन्ति ।
चक्षुः श्रोत्रं क उ देवो युनक्ति ॥
verses.iast:
keneṣitaṁ patati preṣitaṁ manaḥ
kena prāṇaḥ prathamaḥ praiti yuktaḥ
keneṣitāṁ vācam imāṁ vadanti
cakṣuḥ śrotraṁ ka u devo yunakti
verses.translation: By whose will does the mind rush and the life-air move? By whose arrangement do people speak words? What god empowers the eye and the ear? Who indeed harnesses all these?

verses.devanagari:
श्रोत्रस्य श्रोत्रं मनसो मनो यद् ।
वाचो ह वाचं स उ प्राणस्य प्राणः ।
चक्षुषश्चक्षुरतिमुच्य धीराः ।
प्रेत्यास्माल्लोकादमृता भवन्ति ॥
verses.iast:
śrotrasya śrotraṁ manaso mano yad
vāco ha vācaṁ sa u prāṇasya prāṇaḥ
cakṣuṣaś cakṣur atimucya dhīrāḥ
pretyāsmāl lokād amṛtā bhavanti
verses.translation: He is the hearing of the ear and the mind of the mind. He is the speech of speech and the life of life. The wise, freeing themselves from mere sense-identification, leave this world and become immortal.

verses.devanagari:
न तत्र चक्षुर्गच्छति न वाग्गच्छति नो मनः ।
न विद्मो न विजानीमो यथैतदनुशिष्यात् ॥
verses.iast:
na tatra cakṣur gacchati na vāg gacchati no manaḥ
na vidmo na vijānīmo yathaitad anuśiṣyāt
verses.translation: There the eye does not reach, nor speech, nor mind. We do not know, nor do we understand how it may be taught.

verses.devanagari:
अन्यदेव तद्विदितादथो अविदितादधि ।
इति शुश्रुम पूर्वेषां ये नस्तद्व्याचचक्षिरे ॥
verses.iast:
anyadeva tad viditād atho aviditād adhi
iti śuśruma pūrveṣāṁ ye nas tad vyācacakṣire
verses.translation: It is indeed different from the known and beyond the unknown. Thus we have heard from the ancients who explained it to us.

verses.devanagari:
यद् वाचा अनभ्युदितं येन वागभ्युद्यते ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yad vācā anabhyuditaṁ yena vāg abhyudyate
tadeva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate
verses.translation: That which speech cannot express, yet by which speech is expressed—know that to be Brahman, not this which people worship as an object.

verses.devanagari:
यन्मनसा न मनुते येनाहुर्मनो मतम् ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yan manasā na manute yenāhur mano matam
tadeva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate
verses.translation: That which the mind cannot conceive, but by which men say the mind is set to thinking—know that to be Brahman, not this which people worship as an object.

verses.devanagari:
यच्छक्षुषा न पश्यति येन चक्षूंषि पश्यति ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yac cakṣuṣā na paśyati yena cakṣūṁṣi paśyati
tadeva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate
verses.translation: That which is not seen by the eye, yet by which eyes see—know that to be Brahman, not this which people worship as an object.

verses.devanagari:
यच्छ्रोत्रेण न शृणोति येन श्रोत्रमिदं श्रुतम् ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yac chrotreṇa na śṛṇoti yena śrotram idaṁ śrutam
tadeva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate
verses.translation: That which is not heard by the ear, yet by which the ear hears—know that to be Brahman, not this which people worship as an object.

verses.devanagari:
यत्प्राणेन न प्राणिति येन प्राणः प्रणीयते ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदमुपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yat prāṇena na prāṇiti yena prāṇaḥ praṇīyate
tadeva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate
verses.translation: That which is not breathed by the breath, yet by which breath is moved—know that to be Brahman, not this which people worship as an object.

verses.devanagari:
यद् वाचा अनभ्युदितं येन वाग्भ्युद्यते ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदम् उपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yad vāca anabhyuditaṁ yena vāg abhyudyate
tad eva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate
verses.translation: That which speech cannot approach, yet by which speech is moved—know that to be Brahman. Not this which people worship as an object. The Source is beyond words. Still, by His power, all words arise.

verses.devanagari:
यन्मनसा न मनुते येनाहुर्मनो मतम् ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदम् उपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yan manasā na manute yena āhur mano matam
tad eva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate
verses.translation: That which the mind cannot think, yet by which the mind is said to think, know that to be Brahman. Not this which is taken up as a mental image. The Lord is beyond the mind’s grasp, yet He directs the mind.

verses.devanagari:
यच्चक्षुषा न पश्यति येन चक्षूंषि पश्यन्ति ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदम् उपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yac cakṣuṣā na paśyati yena cakṣūṁṣi paśyanti
tad eva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate
verses.translation: That which the eye does not see, yet by which the eyes see—know that to be Brahman. Not this which is seen as an object. Vision depends on the Supreme seer. He is the light of all lights.

verses.devanagari:
यत् श्रोत्रेण न शृणोति येन श्रोत्रम् इदं श्रुतम् ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदम् उपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yat śrotreṇa na śṛṇoti yena śrotram idaṁ śrutam
tad eva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate
verses.translation: That which is not heard by the ear, yet by which the ear is empowered to hear—know that to be Brahman. Not this that is merely a heard object. He is the eternal hearer. All sounds rest upon Him.

verses.devanagari:
यत् प्राणेन न प्राणिति येन प्राणः प्राणीयते ।
तदेव ब्रह्म त्वं विद्धि नेदं यदिदम् उपासते ॥
verses.iast:
yat prāṇena na prāṇiti yena prāṇaḥ prāṇīyate
tad eva brahma tvaṁ viddhi nedaṁ yad idam upāsate
verses.translation: That which breath does not breathe, yet by which breath is made to breathe—know that to be Brahman. Not this which is taken as a finite support. The life of all life is He. Without Him, prāṇa cannot move.
